column4: How can you get firestarter to run automatically on Ubuntu even after restarting? I am using a PPPOE ADSL connection.
firestarter had an autostart option
had/has
slackware is a different linux operating system than Ubuntu.
also firestarter runs in the background automatically during boot.. just because not user interface is present doesn't mean its not running
tr30, do you know the process name? I used ps -e and I didnt see it
try ps -A | grep firestarter
alright thanks
tr30, nothing showed up.
did you set firestarter to start automatically in options?
let me check
Danee, right click a URL and select properties then goto the menu "open with"
sure thing OpopanaxGentoo
tr30, there we go... I had it only checked on start on program startup, lol. So now it should work all the time.
yes.. it should work
tr30, I notice that my friend can run nmap on me and see my open ports still using the -P0 option with nmap. Is there a way to block that you know of?
probably tell firestarter to block all ICMP ports
but that's just an educated guess
tr30, thanks ill test it.
sorry that probably wont work.. misunderstood your quesetion. Is your friend on the same network as you?
tr30, no
he isnt
there isn't any way to stealth open ports. Sorry for the lag
